meanings.definition: A card game similar to rummy, typically played with two players.
meanings.sent1: During the family gathering, we played a fun game of conquian.
meanings.sent2: Let's invite Sarah over to play conquian with us this weekend.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa always cheats at conquian by hiding extra cards up his sleeve.
meanings.sent4: Her strategy in conquian was like a well-thought-out plan in a battle.
meanings.sent5: The sound of shuffling cards filled the room as we prepared for a game of conquian.

meanings.definition: To win or overcome in a game of conquian.
meanings.sent1: I managed to conquian my opponent with a clever move.
meanings.sent2: She always tries to conquian her brother in every game they play.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to conquian the mouse in their playful chase around the house.
meanings.sent4: With determination and focus, he was able to conquian the final level of the game.
meanings.sent5: The underdog team was able to conquian the championship against all odds.
